description: Conversion of existing single family dwellinghouse into five self-contained residential units (4x one-bedroom flats and 1x studio flat); construction of a two storey side extension, a part single part two storey rear extension and roof alterations to include a rear roof dormer and eight rooflights with associated private/communal amenity space, cycle parking, refuse storage and car parking
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers P101 Rev. G, P201 Rev. G , P101 Rev G, S301 Rev. K and P401 Rev. K received 30/10/2012, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority. REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces (including windows), of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details. REASON:	In the interest of securing a high quality development and to ensure that the resulting appearance and construction of the development preserves the character of the building and  the visual amenity of the area as a whole in accordance with section 7 the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 3.8  of the Ealing's Development Strategy. | The residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to meet Lifetime Homes Standards. REASON: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with policy 7.2 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 5.3 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development hereby approved shall comply with the standards of 'Secured by Design'.   REASON:  To ensure the safety of future residents, and to ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements in accordance with policy 7.3 of the London Plan 2011, policies 4.1, 4.4 and 5.5 of the of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the Council's Supplementary Guidance 08 ' Safer Ealing'. |  The cycle parking shown in approved plan S301 Rev. G shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained for the lifetime of the development. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for cycle parking within the site, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2011. | No occupation of the residential units hereby approved shall take place until full details of hard/soft landscape works and all boundary/enclosure treatments, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be completed as approved prior to the first occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON:  To ensure that the development is satisfactorily landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and setting of the building, and in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 3.8 of the Ealing's Development Strategy. | The car parking space shown on the approved plans P101 Rev. G and S301 Rev. K shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and this space shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 9.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development hereby approved shall not be brought into use until the surplus crossover along Locarno Road providing access into the site has been removed and the kerb and the pavement at this location re-instated.  REASON: In pursuance to highway users safety in accordance with policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The refuse storage shown on the approved plan S301 Rev. K shall be made available for use prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and this space shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for refuse storage within the site, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 04 'Refuse and Recycling Facilities'. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details of the BS4142 rating noise, the predicted vibration levels and mitigation works with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided to protect habitable rooms fronting onto Greenford Road from external noise  (including any external plant installed) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The approved details shall be fully implemented prior to the first occupation of the building and retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect occupiers of the residential units  from noise as the development will be affected by traffic noise, in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 5.5 and  4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 10: 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details of an artificial ventilation scheme with air in take from the rear of the site to protect habitable rooms fronting onto Greenford Road shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The approved details shall be fully implemented prior to the first occupation of the building and retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect occupiers of the residential units  from air pollutants as the development will be affected by high levels of traffic, in accordance with policy 7.14 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 5.5 and 2.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
